message.content:
cs.NI, cs.AI, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.DS

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper proposes a new architecture for the mobile internet, which involves scaling the end user platform as per the application and network requirements. This makes it highly likely that the paper belongs to this sub-category.
2. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper mentions the use of machine learning in various fields such as NLP, Computer Vision, Deep learning, and AI. This indicates that the paper could also belong to this sub-category.
3. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper talks about taking computing out of the data center and into the end user platform, which could involve distributed computing. This makes it possible that the paper belongs to this sub-category.
4. cs.SE (Software Engineering) - The paper mentions the development and deployment of applications on a multitude of host platforms, which could involve software engineering practices. This makes it possible that the paper belongs to this sub-category.
5. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - Although not explicitly mentioned, the paper could involve the use of data structures and algorithms in the proposed architecture for the mobile internet. This makes it possible that the paper belongs to this sub-category.
